metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7837 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in BlueZ 5.41 and earlier allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code via the parse_line function used in some userland utilities.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7837` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bluetooth - 5.43-0ubuntu1
bluez - 5.43-0ubuntu1
bluez-cups - 5.43-0ubuntu1
bluez-hcidump - 5.43-0ubuntu1
bluez-obexd - 5.43-0ubuntu1
bluez-tests - 5.43-0ubuntu1
libbluetooth3 - 5.43-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bluez package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.43-0ubuntu1').
